virtuals.subtitle: This was a total dealbreaker, I had to turn off the integration because of this.

231d60dbf038.title: I installed this, then started getting DM’s from jirabot every single time any user did anything…

content.subtitle: This was a total dealbreaker, I had to turn off the integration because of this.

paragraphs.name: eb40
paragraphs.text: I installed this, then started getting DM’s from jirabot every single time any user did anything (transitioned an issue, etc) in JIRA. And because they were DM’s I couldn’t mute them.
This was a total dealbreaker, I had to turn off the integration because of this.

d493c275331a.title: I wrote a Jirabot a couple of years ago to do this exact thing.

paragraphs.name: e4ee
paragraphs.text:
I wrote a Jirabot a couple of years ago to do this exact thing. 
> Upon typing out a bug classification (“TIS-14” in the demo below), the new JIRA bot will post a message right in your conversation containing a basic summary of the issue.

18987ee5463c.title: Just tested this with our JIRA.

paragraphs.name: c411
paragraphs.text: Just tested this with our JIRA. There’s virtually no filtering to limit what notifications are posted. It would be nice if there was a way to filter based on a JQL query or limit notifications to what’s contained on a board.

ee41a69a6ca8.title: Can I create JIRA issues with a Slack command?

paragraphs.name: 9e5b
paragraphs.text: Can I create JIRA issues with a Slack command?

5fc0ef72eb93.title: Looks like it doesn’t work with projects where the key contains a number.

paragraphs.text: Looks like it doesn’t work with projects where the key contains a number. It works for 2 of 3 JIRA projects and the one it doesn’t work for contains a number in the issue key for the project.

98f214b1d45.title: It looks like this only works with atlassian hosted jira?

paragraphs.name: 0e78
paragraphs.text: It looks like this only works with atlassian hosted jira? We’ve got internal, any way to make it work?

c466b1ff5094.title: Doesn’t seem to work on our cloud instance.

paragraphs.name: 92a8
paragraphs.text: Doesn’t seem to work on our cloud instance. Keeps telling me “This JIRA Cloud instance does not appear to have the Slack integration available”. I couldn’t find any way to enable Slack integration. Please help.

8f95189ff22f.title: How can we get this on Jira Hosted version? Is Jira Hosted being deprecated in favor of Jira Cloud?

paragraphs.name: ce41
paragraphs.text: How can we get this on Jira Hosted version? Is Jira Hosted being deprecated in favor of Jira Cloud?

5860ec95b194.title: all I get is “This JIRA Cloud instance does not appear to have the Slack integration available…

paragraphs.name: 3c15
paragraphs.text: all I get is “This JIRA Cloud instance does not appear to have the Slack integration available” with a confusing rabbit hole of links and accounts and marketplaces to “activate” when i try and figure it out.

a22ff8ece83e.title: would be awesome if there was an option to get notification when issue is moved between projects.

paragraphs.name: 90ad
paragraphs.text: would be awesome if there was an option to get notification when issue is moved between projects. we have this flow where new bugs are first gathered into one umbrella project and then moved to specific team projects.

726453b5c5a9.title: Assuming that the JIRA bot functionality will not be coming for those of us on the JIRA Server…

paragraphs.name: cd7e
paragraphs.text: Assuming that the JIRA bot functionality will not be coming for those of us on the JIRA Server platform?

eb3339c7f07a.title: Anyone who wants more features like create issue, transition, comment, log work, scheduled messages…

paragraphs.name: fc45
paragraphs.text: Anyone who wants more features like create issue, transition, comment, log work, scheduled messages and more + a bot that works with hosted JIRA instances can check out our bot at www.nextup.ai or on the Slack App Store — Nextup Jira | Slack
